meanings.sent1: The coach tried to sool the team to victory with an inspiring speech.
meanings.sent2: She always knows how to sool her friends into trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to sool the birds into sharing their food.
meanings.sent4: The passionate leader sooled the crowd into action with his powerful words.
meanings.sent5: The music sooled my emotions, making me want to dance.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or cheated
meanings.sent1: Be careful, he is a known sool who falls for scams easily.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a sool when she lost all her money to a con artist.
meanings.sent3: The sool thought he had won a free vacation but ended up being scammed.
meanings.sent4: The poor sool fell for the same trick twice, showing his gullibility.
meanings.sent5: The sool's trusting nature made him an easy target for fraudsters.
